created_at: they will still go through with the purchase of tendered shares (which they can opt to do according to the packet they sent) and then negotiate a higher second offer.  The idea being people are far less inclined to tender shares if a company says "Yeah
column3: tender and we'll buy whatever" rather than "Hey listen
column4: if we don't get enough everyone misses out."  The latter adds urgency.
